intro: Simira walteri, commonly known as the Walter's simira, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
